self.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1

class.description: The Study Data Tabulation Model Implementation Guide (SDTMIG) includes 3 types of special-purpose datasets: Domain datasets-Demographics (DM), Comments (CO), Subject Elements (SE), and Subject Visits (SV)-which contain subject-level data Trial Design Model (TDM) datasets, which contain trial-level data Relationship datasets These datasets are described in SDTMIG Section 2.3. CDASH does not currently contain information on Trial Design Model or Relationship datasets. Because CDASH standards are for collection of subject-level data, the collection of Trial Design domains is out of the scope for CDASH. CDASHIG contains information on these Special-Purpose Domains: Comments (CO) and Demographics (DM). (Source: CDASHIG v2.1, Section 7)

field.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field.label: Study Identifier
field.name: STUDYID
field.questionText: What is the study identifier?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field.label: Study Site Identifier
field.name: SITEID
field.questionText: What is the site identifier?

field.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
field.name: SUBJID
field.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

field.definition: A subject's date of birth (with or without the time of birth). The complete Date of Birth is made from the temporal components of Birth Year, Birth Month, Birth Day and Birth Time.
field.label: Birth Date
field.name: BRTHDAT
field.questionText: What is the subject's date of birth?

field.definition: Day of birth of the subject in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD).
field.label: Birth Day
field.name: BRTHDD
field.questionText: What is the subject's day of birth?

field.definition: Month of birth of the subject in an unambiguous date format (e.g., MMM).
field.label: Birth Month
field.name: BRTHMO
field.questionText: What is the subject's month of birth?

field.definition: The year of birth of the subject in an unambiguous date format (e.g., YYYY).
field.label: Birth Year
field.name: BRTHYY
field.questionText: What is the subject's year of birth?

field.definition: The time of birth of the subject in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm)
field.label: Birth Time
field.name: BRTHTIM
field.questionText: What is the subject's time of birth?

field.definition: The age of the subject expressed in AGEU.
field.label: Age
field.name: AGE
field.questionText: What is the subject's age?

field.definition: Those units of time that are routinely used to express the age of a person.
field.label: Age Units
field.name: AGEU
field.questionText: What is the age unit used?

field.definition: The date of collection represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY)
field.label: Demographics Collection Date
field.name: DMDAT
field.questionText: What is the date of collection?

field.definition: Sex of the subject as determined by the investigator.
field.label: Sex
field.name: SEX
field.questionText: What is the sex of the subject?

field.definition: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.
field.label: Ethnicity
field.name: ETHNIC
field.questionText: Do you consider yourself Hispanic/Latino or not Hispanic/Latino?

field.definition: A social group characterized by a distinctive social and cultural tradition maintained from generation to generation, a common history and origin and a sense of identification with the group; members of the group have distinctive features in their way of life, shared experiences and often a common genetic heritage; these features may be reflected in their experience of health and disease.
field.label: Collected Ethnicity
field.name: CETHNIC
field.questionText: What is the ethnicity of the subject?

field.definition: An arbitrary classification based on physical characteristics; a group of persons related by common descent or heredity (U.S. Center for Disease Control).
field.label: Race
field.name: RACE
field.questionText: Which of the following five racial designations best describes you? (More than one choice is acceptable.)

field.definition: An arbitrary classification based on physical characteristics; a group of persons related by common descent or heredity (US Centers for Disease Control).
field.label: Collected Race
field.name: CRACE
field.questionText: Which of the following racial designations best describes you? (More than one choice is acceptable.)

field.definition: A free-text field to be used when none of the preprinted values for RACE are applicable or if another, unprinted selection should be added to those preprinted values.
field.label: Race Other
field.name: RACEOTH
field.questionText: What was the other race?

class.label: Special-Purpose
class.name: Special-Purpose

class.description: The Interventions class includes CDASH domains that define collection standards for investigational treatments, therapeutic treatments, and procedures that are intentionally administered to the subject either as specified by the study protocol (e.g., exposure), coincident with the study assessment period (e.g., concomitant medications), or self-administered by the subject (e.g., alcohol, tobacco, caffeine). (Source: CDASHIG v2.1, Section 8.1)

field.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field.label: Study Identifier
field.name: STUDYID
field.questionText: What is the study identifier?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field.label: Study Site Identifier
field.name: SITEID
field.questionText: What is the site identifier?

field.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
field.name: SUBJID
field.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

field.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Category for Medication
field.name: CMCAT
field.questionText: What is the category for the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

field.definition: A sub-division of the CMCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Subcategory for Medication
field.name: CMSCAT
field.questionText: What is the subcategory for the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

field.definition: An indication whether or not any (concomitant) medications/treatments/therapies were taken/given.
field.label: Any Concomitant Medications Taken
field.name: CMYN
field.questionText: Were/Was any (concomitant) [medication(s)/treatment(s)/therapy(ies)] taken?

field.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field.label: CM Sponsor-Defined Identifier
field.name: CMSPID
field.questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

self.title: Reported Name of Drug, Med, or Therapy

field.definition: Verbatim medication name or treatments (include only treatments with data collection characteristics similar to medications).
field.label: Reported Name of Drug, Med, or Therapy
field.name: CMTRT
field.questionText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] (name/term)?

field.definition: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is prespecified on a CRF.
field.label: CM Pre-Specified
field.name: CMPRESP

field.definition: An indication whether the prespecified medication/treatment/therapy (CMTRT) or the group of medications/treatments/therapies was administered when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention is solicited.
field.label: CM Occurrence
field.name: CMOCCUR
field.questionText: Did the subject take [prespecified (concomitant) medication/treatment/therapy/dose]?; Has the subject taken [prespecified (concomitant) medication/treatment/therapy/dose]?

field.definition: Medication Ingredients.
field.label: Concomitant Meds Active Ingredients
field.name: CMINGRD
field.questionText: What were the active ingredients?

field.definition: The condition, disease, symptom, or disorder that the concomitant (non-study) medication/treatment/therapy was used to address or investigate (e.g., why the medication/treatment/therapy was taken or administered).
field.label: CM Indication
field.name: CMINDC
field.questionText: For what indication was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] taken?

field.definition: Identifier for the adverse event that is the indication for this medication/treatment/therapy.
field.label: Related Adverse Event ID
field.name: CMAENO
field.questionText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s) for which the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken?

field.definition: Identifier for the medical history condition that is the indication for this medication/treatment/therapy.
field.label: Related Medical History Event ID
field.name: CMMHNO
field.questionText: What was the identifier for the medical history event(s) for which the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] was taken?

field.definition: The dose of medication/treatment (e.g., --TRT ) given at one time represented as a numeric value.
field.label: CM Dose per Administration
field.name: CMDOSE
field.questionText: What was the individual dose (of the concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy] per administration)?

field.definition: The dose of medication/treatment taken per administration.
field.label: Concomitant Meds Dose Description
field.name: CMDSTXT
field.questionText: What was the individual dose of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

field.definition: The total amount of CMTRT taken over a day using the units in CMDOSU.
field.label: CM Total Daily Dose
field.name: CMDOSTOT
field.questionText: What was the total daily dose of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

field.definition: The unit associated with the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy taken (e.g., mg in "2 mg 3 times per day").
field.label: CM Dose Units
field.name: CMDOSU
field.questionText: What is the unit (for the dose of concomitant [medication/treatment/therapy])?

field.definition: The pharmaceutical dosage form in which the CMTRT is physically presented.
field.label: CM Dose Form
field.name: CMDOSFRM
field.questionText: What was the dose form of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

field.definition: The number of doses given/administered/taken during a specific interval.
field.label: CM Dosing Frequency per Interval
field.name: CMDOSFRQ
field.questionText: What was the frequency of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

field.definition: The route of administration of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy].
field.label: CM Route of Administration
field.name: CMROUTE
field.questionText: What was the route of administration of the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy]?

field.definition: The start date when the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy was first taken, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Concomitant Meds Start Date
field.name: CMSTDAT
field.questionText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy/dose] start date?

field.definition: The time the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy was started, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field.label: Concomitant Meds Start Time
field.name: CMSTTIM
field.questionText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy/dose] start time?

field.definition: Indication the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy was given or taken prior to [CMSTTPT] or prior to the date in DM.RFSTDTC.
field.label: Prior Concomitant Meds
field.name: CMPRIOR
field.questionText: Was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] given/taken prior to [CMSTTPT]?; Was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] given/taken prior to study start?

field.definition: Indication the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy is ongoing when no end date is provided.
field.label: Ongoing Concomitant Meds
field.name: CMONGO
field.questionText: Was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy] ongoing (as of [the study-specific time point or period])?

field.definition: The date that the subject ended/stopped taking the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Concomitant Meds End Date
field.name: CMENDAT
field.questionText: What was the (concomitant) [medication/treatment/therapy/dose] end date?

field.definition: The time when the subject ended/stopped taking the concomitant medication/treatment/therapy represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field.label: Concomitant Meds End Time
field.name: CMENTIM
field.questionText: What was the [medication/treatment/therapy/dose] end time?

field.definition: The dictionary- or sponsor-defined standardized text description of the topic variable, CMTRT, or the modified topic variable (CMMODIFY), if applicable.
field.label: Standardized Medication Name
field.name: CMDECOD

field.definition: The class for the intervention, often obtained from a coding dictionary.
field.label: CM Medication Class
field.name: CMCLAS

field.definition: The assigned dictionary code for the class for the intervention.
field.label: CM Medication Class Code
field.name: CMCLASCD

field.definition: Dictionary text description of the first level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System. Indicates the anatomical main group.
field.label: ATC Level 1 Description
field.name: CMATC1

field.definition: Dictionary code denoting the first level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System. Indicates the anatomical main group.
field.label: ATC Level 1 Code
field.name: CMATC1CD

field.definition: Dictionary text description for the second level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System. Indicates the therapeutic main group.
field.label: ATC Level 2 Description
field.name: CMATC2

field.definition: Dictionary code denoting the second level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System. Indicates the therapeutic main group.
field.label: ATC Level 2 Code
field.name: CMATC2CD

field.definition: Dictionary text description of the third level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System. Indicates the therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup.
field.label: ATC Level 3 Description
field.name: CMATC3

field.definition: Dictionary code denoting the third level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System. Indicates the therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup.
field.label: ATC Level 3 Code
field.name: CMATC3CD

field.definition: Dictionary text description of the fourth level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System. Indicates the chemical/therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup.
field.label: ATC Level 4 Description
field.name: CMATC4

field.definition: Dictionary code denoting the fourth level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification System. Indicates the chemical/therapeutic/pharmacological subgroup.
field.label: ATC Level 4 Code
field.name: CMATC4CD

field.definition: Dictionary text description of the fifth level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification system. Indicates the chemical substance.
field.label: ATC Level 5 Description
field.name: CMATC5

field.definition: Dictionary code denoting the fifth level of hierarchy within the Anatomical Therapeutic Chemical Classification system. Indicates the chemical substance.
field.label: ATC Level 5 Code
field.name: CMATC5CD

field.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field.label: Study Identifier
field.name: STUDYID
field.questionText: What is the study identifier?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field.label: Study Site Identifier
field.name: SITEID
field.questionText: What is the site identifier?

field.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
field.name: SUBJID
field.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

field.definition: An indication whether or not the subject had any procedures performed.
field.label: Any Procedures Performed
field.name: PRYN
field.questionText: Were any surgical, therapeutic, or diagnostic procedures performed?

field.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Procedure Category
field.name: PRCAT
field.questionText: What was the category of the procedure?

field.definition: A sub-division of the PRCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Procedure Subcategory
field.name: PRSCAT
field.questionText: What was the subcategory of the procedure?

field.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field.label: Procedure Sponsor-Defined Identifier
field.name: PRSPID
field.questionText: [Sponsor defined question]

field.definition: The verbatim surgical, therapeutic, or diagnostic procedure's name.
field.label: Reported Name of Procedure
field.name: PRTRT
field.questionText: What was the procedure name?

field.definition: The dictionary- or sponsor-defined standardized text description of PRTRT, or the modified topic variable (PRMODIFY), if applicable.
field.label: Standardized Procedure Name
field.name: PRDECOD

field.definition: If the value for PRTERM is modified for coding purposes, then the modified text is placed here.
field.label: Modified Procedure Name
field.name: PRMODIFY

field.definition: An indication that a specific intervention or a group of interventions is prespecified on a CRF.
field.label: Procedure prespecified
field.name: PRPRESP

field.definition: An indication whether a prespecified procedure (PRTRT) happened when information about the occurrence of a specific intervention is solicited.
field.label: Procedure Occurrence
field.name: PROCCUR
field.questionText: Was [PRDECOD/PRTRT] performed?; Has the subject had [PRDECOD/PRTRT]?

field.definition: An explanation of why a scheduled procedure did or did not occur.
field.label: Procedure Reason for Occur Value
field.name: PRREASOC
field.questionText: What was the reason that the procedure was (not) performed?

field.definition: An explanation of why the data are not available.
field.label: Procedure Reason Not Done
field.name: PRREASND
field.questionText: What was the reason not done?

field.definition: Indication the procedure occurred prior to [PRSTTPT] or prior to the date in DM.RFSTDTC.
field.label: Prior Procedure
field.name: PRPRIOR
field.questionText: Was the procedure performed prior to [PRSTTPT]?; Was the procedure performed prior to study start?

field.definition: The date or start date of when the procedure started or was performed, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Procedure Start Date
field.name: PRSTDAT
field.questionText: What was the procedure (start) date ?

field.definition: Indication the procedure is ongoing when no end date is provided.
field.label: Ongoing Procedure
field.name: PRONGO
field.questionText: Was the procedure ongoing (as of the [study-specific timepoint or period])?

field.definition: The end date of the procedure, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Procedure End Date
field.name: PRENDAT
field.questionText: What was the procedure (end) date?

field.definition: The condition, disease, symptom, or disorder that the procedure was used to address or investigate (e.g., why the therapy was taken or administered, why the procedure was performed).
field.label: Procedure Indication
field.name: PRINDC
field.questionText: For what indication was the [PRTRT] performed?

field.definition: Identifier for the adverse event that is the indication for this procedure.
field.label: Related Adverse Event ID
field.name: PRAENO
field.questionText: What was the identifier for the adverse event(s) for which the procedure was performed?

field.definition: Identifier for the medical history event that is the indication for this procedure.
field.label: Related Medical History Event ID
field.name: PRMHNO
field.questionText: What was the identifier for the medical history event(s) for which the procedure was performed?

field.definition: The dose/amount administered during the procedure.
field.label: Procedure Dose Description
field.name: PRDSTXT
field.questionText: What was the [dose/amount] of [PRTRT] (per administration/for the procedure)?

field.definition: The unit for intended dose/amount for PRDOSE, PRDOSTOT, or PRDOSTXT.
field.label: Procedure Dose Unit
field.name: PRDOSU
field.questionText: What was the unit?

field.definition: The number/amount of the procedure that was given/administered/taken during a specific interval.
field.label: Procedure Frequency per Interval
field.name: PRDOSFRQ
field.questionText: What was the frequency of [PRTRT]?

field.definition: The route of administration of the procedure.
field.label: Procedure Route of Administration
field.name: PRROUTE
field.questionText: What was the route of administration of the procedure?

field.definition: A description of the anatomical location of an procedure, such as location of a biopsy.
field.label: Location of Procedure
field.name: PRLOC
field.questionText: What was the anatomical location where the procedure was performed?

field.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing side of the body for the procedure administration.
field.label: Procedure Laterality
field.name: PRLAT
field.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the administration?

field.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field.label: Procedure Directionality
field.name: PRDIR
field.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the procedure?

field.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
field.label: Procedure Portion or Totality
field.name: PRPORTOT
field.questionText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location that was treated?

field.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
field.label: Procedure Fasting Status
field.name: PRFAST
field.questionText: Was the subject fasting?

field.definition: The text description of the (intended) schedule or regimen for the procedure.
field.label: Procedure Intended Dose Regimen
field.name: PRDOSRGM
field.questionText: What was the intended procedure regimen?

field.definition: An indication whether or not the procedure dose/amount was adjusted.
field.label: Procedure Adjusted
field.name: PRDOSADJ
field.questionText: Was the procedure dose adjusted?

field.definition: Description or explanation of why a procedure dose/amount was adjusted.
field.label: Reason for Procedure Adjustment
field.name: PRADJ
field.questionText: What was the reason the procedure dose was adjusted?

field.definition: Indication whether the subject completed the intended regimen.
field.label: Completed Procedure
field.name: PRTRTCMP
field.questionText: Did the subject complete the full course of the [PRTRT]?

field.definition: An indication whether the procedure was interrupted.
field.label: Procedure Interrupted
field.name: PRITRPYN
field.questionText: Was the procedure interrupted?

field.definition: An indication of why the intervention was interrupted.
field.label: Reason Procedure Interrupted
field.name: PRITRPRS
field.questionText: Why was the procedure interrupted?

field.definition: The collected duration of the procedure interruption.
field.label: Procedure Interruption Duration
field.name: PRCINTD
field.questionText: What was the duration of the procedure interruption?

field.definition: The unit for the collected duration of the procedure interruption.
field.label: Procedure Interruption Duration Units
field.name: PRCINTDU
field.questionText: What was the interruption duration unit?

field.definition: MedDRA text description of the Lowest Level Term.
field.label: Procedure Lowest Level Term
field.name: PRLLT

field.definition: MedDRA Lowest Level Term code.
field.label: Procedure Lowest Level Term Code
field.name: PRLLTCD

field.definition: MedDRA code for the Preferred Term.
field.label: Procedure Preferred Term Code
field.name: PRPTCD

field.definition: MedDRA text description of High Level Term from the primary path.
field.label: Procedure High Level Term
field.name: PRHLT

field.definition: MedDRA High Level Term code from the primary path.
field.label: Procedure High Level Term Code
field.name: PRHLTCD

field.definition: MedDRA text description of the High Level Group Term from the primary path.
field.label: Procedure High Level Group Term
field.name: PRHLGT

self.title: Procedure High Level Group Term Code

field.definition: MedDRA High Level Group Term code from the primary path.
field.label: Procedure High Level Group Term Code
field.name: PRHLGTCD

field.definition: MedDRA Primary System Organ Class description associated with the intervention.
field.label: PR Primary System Organ Class
field.name: PRSOC

self.title: PR Primary System Organ Class Code

field.definition: MedDRA Primary System Organ Class code.
field.label: PR Primary System Organ Class Code
field.name: PRSOCCD

class.label: Interventions
class.name: Interventions

class.description: The Events class includes CDASH domains that define standards for the collection of occurrences or incidents occurring during a trial (e.g., adverse events, disposition) or prior to a trial (e.g., medical history). (Source: CDASHIG v2.1, Section 8.2)

field.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field.label: Study Identifier
field.name: STUDYID
field.questionText: What is the study identifier?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field.label: Study Site Identifier
field.name: SITEID
field.questionText: What is the site identifier?

field.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
field.name: SUBJID
field.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

field.definition: An indication whether or not any AEs were experienced during the study.
field.label: Any Adverse Event
field.name: AEYN
field.questionText: Were any adverse events experienced?

field.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Category for Adverse Event
field.name: AECAT
field.questionText: What is the category of the adverse event?

field.definition: A sub-division of the AECAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Subcategory for Adverse Event
field.name: AESCAT
field.questionText: What is the subcategory of the adverse event?

field.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field.label: AE Sponsor-Defined Identifier
field.name: AESPID
field.questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

self.title: Reported Term for the Adverse Event

field.definition: The reported or prespecified name of the adverse event.
field.label: Reported Term for the Adverse Event
field.name: AETERM
field.questionText: What is the adverse event term?

field.definition: An indication whether a prespecified adverse event or a group of adverse events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
field.label: Adverse Event Occurrence
field.name: AEOCCUR
field.questionText: Did the subject have [prespecified adverse event/group of adverse events]?

field.definition: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are prespecified on a CRF.
field.label: prespecified Adverse Event
field.name: AEPRESP

field.definition: The start date of the adverse event, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Adverse Event Start Date
field.name: AESTDAT
field.questionText: What is the adverse event start date?

field.definition: The start time of the adverse event, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss)
field.label: Start Time of Adverse Event
field.name: AESTTIM
field.questionText: What is the adverse event start time?

field.definition: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the adverse event.
field.label: AE Location of Event
field.name: AELOC
field.questionText: What is the anatomical location of the adverse event?

field.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
field.label: Adverse Event Laterality
field.name: AELAT
field.questionText: What is the side of the anatomical location of the adverse event?

field.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field.label: Adverse Event Directionality
field.name: AEDIR
field.questionText: What is the directionality of the anatomical location of the adverse event?

field.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution (i.e., arrangement of, apportioning of).
field.label: AE Location Portion or Totality
field.name: AEPORTOT
field.questionText: What is the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the adverse event?

field.definition: Indication that an adverse event is ongoing when no End Date is provided.
field.label: Ongoing Adverse Event
field.name: AEONGO
field.questionText: Is the adverse event ongoing (as of [the study-specific time point or period])?

field.definition: The date when the adverse event resolved/ended, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Adverse Event End Date
field.name: AEENDAT
field.questionText: What was the adverse event end date?

field.definition: The time when the adverse event ended/resolved, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field.label: End Time of Adverse Event
field.name: AEENTIM
field.questionText: What was the adverse event end time?

field.definition: The severity or intensity of the event.
field.label: AE Severity/Intensity
field.name: AESEV
field.questionText: What is the severity of the adverse event?

field.definition: The grade of the severity of the event using a standard "toxicity" scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).
field.label: AE Standard Toxicity Grade
field.name: AETOXGR
field.questionText: What is the [NCI CTCAE/Name of scale (toxicity) grade] of the adverse event?

field.definition: An indication whether or not the adverse event is determined to be "serious" based on what is defined in the protocol.
field.label: AE Serious Event
field.name: AESER
field.questionText: Was the adverse event serious?

field.definition: An indication the serious adverse event resulted in death.
field.label: Results in Death
field.name: AESDTH
field.questionText: Did the adverse event result in death?

field.definition: Date of death for any subject who died.
field.label: Death Date
field.name: DTHDAT
field.questionText: What [is/was] the subject's date of death?

field.definition: An indication the serious adverse event was life threatening.
field.label: Is Life Threatening
field.name: AESLIFE
field.questionText: Was the adverse event life threatening?

field.definition: An indication the serious adverse event resulted in an initial or prolonged hospitalization.
field.label: Requires or Prolongs Hospitalization
field.name: AESHOSP
field.questionText: Did the adverse event result in initial or prolonged hospitalization for the subject?

field.definition: An indication the serious adverse event was associated with a persistent or significant disability or incapacity.
field.label: Persist or Signif Disability/Incapacity
field.name: AESDISAB
field.questionText: Did the adverse event result in disability or permanent damage?

field.definition: An indication the serious adverse event was associated with a congenital anomaly or birth defect.
field.label: Congenital Anomaly or Birth Defect
field.name: AESCONG
field.questionText: Was the adverse event associated with a congenital anomaly or birth defect?

field.definition: An indication an adverse event required medical or surgical intervention to preclude permanent impairment of a body function, or prevent permanent damage to a body structure, due to the use of a medical product.
field.label: Needs Intervention to Prevent Impairment
field.name: AESINTV
field.questionText: Did the adverse event require intervention to prevent permanent impairment or damage resulting from the use of a medical product?

field.definition: An indication additional categories for seriousness apply.
field.label: Other Medically Important Serious Event
field.name: AESMIE
field.questionText: Was the adverse event a medically important event not covered by other serious criteria?

field.definition: An indication the serious event was associated with the development of cancer.
field.label: Involves Cancer
field.name: AESCAN
field.questionText: Was the adverse event associated with the development of cancer?

field.definition: An indication the serious event occurred with an overdose.
field.label: Occurred with Overdose
field.name: AESOD
field.questionText: Did the adverse event occur with an overdose?

field.definition: An indication the study treatment had a causal effect on the adverse event, as determined by the clinician/investigator.
field.label: AE Causality
field.name: AEREL
field.questionText: Was this adverse event related to study treatment?

field.definition: A description of the action taken with study treatment as a result of the event.
field.label: Action Taken with Study Treatment
field.name: AEACN
field.questionText: What action was taken with study treatment?

field.definition: A description of the action taken, with respect to a device used in a study (which may or may not be the device under study), as a result of the event.
field.label: Actions Taken with Device
field.name: AEACNDEV
field.questionText: What action was taken with a device used in the study?

field.definition: A description of other action taken as a result of the event that is unrelated to dose adjustments of the study treatment.
field.label: Other Action Taken
field.name: AEACNOTH
field.questionText: What other action was taken?

field.definition: A description of the outcome of an event.
field.label: Outcome of Adverse Event
field.name: AEOUT
field.questionText: What is the outcome of this adverse event?

field.definition: An indication whether the event caused the subject to discontinue from the study.
field.label: AE Caused Study Discontinuation
field.name: AEDIS
field.questionText: Did the adverse event cause the subject to be discontinued from the study?

field.definition: An indication whether in the investigator's opinion the event may have been due to a treatment other than study treatment.
field.label: AE Related to Non-Study Treatment
field.name: AERLNSYN
field.questionText: Was this adverse event due to treatment other than study treatment?

field.definition: Description of the investigator's opinion as to whether the adverse event may have been due to a treatment other than study treatment.
field.label: AE Relationship to Non-Study Treatment
field.name: AERELNST
field.questionText: What is the relationship to non-study treatment?

field.definition: An adverse event of special interest (serious or non-serious) is one of scientific and medical concern specific to the sponsor's product or program, for which ongoing monitoring and rapid communication by the investigator to the sponsor can be appropriate. Such an event might warrant further investigation in order to characterize and understand it. Depending on the nature of the event, rapid communication by the trial sponsor to other parties (e.g., regulators) might also be warranted.
field.label: Adverse Event of Special Interest
field.name: AESI
field.questionText: Is this event of special interest?

field.definition: Used to indicate the pattern of the event over time.
field.label: Pattern of Adverse Event
field.name: AEPATT
field.questionText: What is the adverse event pattern?

field.definition: An indication whether a concomitant or additional treatment given because of the occurrence of the event.
field.label: Concomitant or Additional Trtmnt Given
field.name: AECONTRT
field.questionText: Was a concomitant or additional treatment given due to this adverse event?

field.definition: If the value for AETERM is modified to facilitate coding, then AEMODIFY will contain the modified text.
field.label: AE Modified Reported Term
field.name: AEMODIFY

field.definition: The dictionary or standardized text description of AETERM or the modified topic variable (AEMODIFY), if applicable.
field.label: AE Dictionary-Derived Term
field.name: AEDECOD

field.definition: MedDRA text description of the Lowest Level Term.
field.label: AE Lowest Level Term
field.name: AELLT

field.definition: MedDRA Lowest Level Term code.
field.label: AE Lowest Level Term Code
field.name: AELLTCD

field.definition: MedDRA code for the Preferred Term.
field.label: AE Preferred Term Code
field.name: AEPTCD

field.definition: MedDRA text description of the High Level Term from the primary path.
field.label: AE High Level Term
field.name: AEHLT

field.definition: MedDRA High Level Term code from the primary path.
field.label: AE High Level Term Code
field.name: AEHLTCD

field.definition: MedDRA text description of the High Level Group Term from the primary path.
field.label: AE High Level Group Term
field.name: AEHLGT

self.title: AE High Level Group Term Code

field.definition: MedDRA High Level Group Term code from the primary path.
field.label: AE High Level Group Term Code
field.name: AEHLGTCD

field.definition: MedDRA Primary System Organ Class text description associated with the event.
field.label: AE Primary System Organ Class
field.name: AESOC

self.title: AE Primary System Organ Class Code

field.definition: MedDRA code for the primary System Organ Class.
field.label: AE Primary System Organ Class Code
field.name: AESOCCD

field.definition: An indication whether any other actions were taken in response to the adverse event that were unrelated to study treatment dose changes or other non-study treatments given because of this adverse event.
field.label: Any Other Actions Taken
field.name: AEACNOYN
field.questionText: Were any other actions taken in response to this adverse event?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field.label: Study Identifier
field.name: STUDYID
field.questionText: What is the study identifier?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field.label: Study Site Identifier
field.name: SITEID
field.questionText: What is the site identifier?

field.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
field.name: SUBJID
field.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

field.definition: An indication whether or not there was any medical history to report.
field.label: Any Medical History Event
field.name: MHYN
field.questionText: Were any medical conditions or events reported?; Has the subject had any medical conditions or events?

field.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Category for Medical History
field.name: MHCAT
field.questionText: What was the category of the medical history?

field.definition: A sub-division of the MHCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Subcategory for Medical History
field.name: MHSCAT
field.questionText: What was the subcategory of the medical history?

field.definition: The date on which the medical history was collected, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Medical History Collection Date
field.name: MHDAT
field.questionText: What was the date the medical history was collected?

field.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field.label: MH Sponsor-Defined Identifier
field.name: MHSPID
field.questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

field.definition: Specifies the aspect of the medical condition or event by which MHSTDTC and/or the MHENDTC is defined.
field.label: Medical History Event Date Type
field.name: MHEVDTYP
field.questionText: What was the medical history event date type?

self.title: Reported Term for the Medical History

field.definition: The reported or prespecified name of the medical condition or event.
field.label: Reported Term for the Medical History
field.name: MHTERM
field.questionText: What is the medical condition or event term?

field.definition: An indication whether a prespecified medical condition/event or a group of medical conditions/events occurred when information about the occurrence of a specific event is solicited.
field.label: Medical History Occurrence
field.name: MHOCCUR
field.questionText: Did the subject have [prespecified medical condition/event/group of medical conditions]; Is the [prespecified medical occurring]?

field.definition: An indication that a specific event, or group of events, are prespecified on a CRF.
field.label: Medical History Event prespecified
field.name: MHPRESP

field.definition: An indication whether the event occurred prior to study start.
field.label: Prior Medical History Event
field.name: MHPRIOR
field.questionText: Did the medical condition or event start prior to [MHSTTPT]?; Did the medical condition or event start prior to study start?

field.definition: Indication the medical condition or event is ongoing when no end date is provided.
field.label: Ongoing Medical History Event
field.name: MHONGO
field.questionText: Is the medical condition or event ongoing (as of the [study-specific timepoint or period])?

self.title: MH Disease or Symptom Under Control

field.definition: Indication whether the medical condition or event is under control at the time of data collection.
field.label: MH Disease or Symptom Under Control
field.name: MHCTRL
field.questionText: Is the medical condition or event under control?

field.definition: The start date of medical history event or condition represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Medical History Event Start Date
field.name: MHSTDAT
field.questionText: What [is/was] the [medical event or condition/category of the event] start date?

field.definition: The end date of medical history event or condition represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Medical History Event End Date
field.name: MHENDAT
field.questionText: What[is/was] the[medical event or condition/category of the event] end date?

field.definition: A description of the anatomical location relevant for the medical condition or event.
field.label: Medical History Event Location
field.name: MHLOC
field.questionText: What was the anatomical location of the medical condition or event?

field.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body relevant for the event.
field.label: Medical History Event Laterality
field.name: MHLAT
field.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the medical condition or event?

field.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field.label: Medical History Directionality
field.name: MHDIR
field.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the medical condition or event?

self.title: MH Event Location Portion or Totality

field.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the distribution, which means arrangement of, apportioning of.
field.label: MH Event Location Portion or Totality
field.name: MHPORTOT
field.questionText: What was the portion or totality of the anatomical location of the of the medical condition or event?

field.definition: If the value for MHTERM is modified to facilitate coding, then MHMODIFY will contain the modified text.
field.label: MH Modified Reported Term
field.name: MHMODIFY

field.definition: The dictionary text description of MHTERM or the modified topic variable (MH MODIFY), if applicable.
field.label: MH Dictionary-Derived Term
field.name: MHDECOD

self.title: Medical History Event Lowest Level Term

field.definition: MedDRA Dictionary text description of the Lowest Level Term.
field.label: Medical History Event Lowest Level Term
field.name: MHLLT

self.title: MH Event Lowest Level Term Code

field.definition: MedDRA Lowest Level Term code.
field.label: MH Event Lowest Level Term Code
field.name: MHLLTCD

field.definition: MedDRA code for the Preferred Term.
field.label: MH Event Preferred Term Code
field.name: MHPTCD

self.title: Medical History Event High Level Term

field.definition: MedDRA text description of the High Level Term from the primary path.
field.label: Medical History Event High Level Term
field.name: MHHLT

self.title: MH Event High Level Term Code

field.definition: MedDRA High Level Term code from the primary path.
field.label: MH Event High Level Term Code
field.name: MHHLTCD

self.title: MH Event High Level Group Term

field.definition: MedDRA text description of the High Level Group Term from the primary path.
field.label: MH Event High Level Group Term
field.name: MHHLGT

self.title: MH Event High Level Group Term Code

field.definition: MedDRA High Level Group Term code from the primary path.
field.label: MH Event High Level Group Term Code
field.name: MHHLGTCD

self.title: MH Event Primary System Organ Class

field.definition: MedDRA Primary System Organ Class description associated with the event.
field.label: MH Event Primary System Organ Class
field.name: MHSOC

self.title: MH Event Primary System Organ Class Code

field.definition: MedDRA code for the primary System Organ Class.
field.label: MH Event Primary System Organ Class Code
field.name: MHSOCCD

class.label: Events
class.name: Events

class.description: The Findings class includes CDASH domains that define collection standards for results from evaluations such as physical examinations, laboratory tests, electrocardiogram (ECG) testing, and responses to questionnaires. (Source: CDASHIG v2.1, Section 8.3)

field.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field.label: Study Identifier
field.name: STUDYID
field.questionText: What is the study identifier?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field.label: Study Site Identifier
field.name: SITEID
field.questionText: What is the site identifier?

field.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
field.name: SUBJID
field.questionText: What is the subject identifier?

field.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
field.label: Visit Name
field.name: VISIT
field.questionText: What is the visit name?

field.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
field.label: Visit Date
field.name: VISDAT
field.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

field.definition: An indication whether or not a planned vital signs measurement, series of vital signs measurements, tests, or observations was performed.
field.label: Vital Signs Performed
field.name: VSPERF
field.questionText: Were vital signs performed?

field.definition: The date of the vital signs measurement, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Vital Signs Date
field.name: VSDAT
field.questionText: What was the date of the vital signs measurement?

field.definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field.label: Vital Signs Time
field.name: VSTIM
field.questionText: What was the time of the vital signs measurement?

field.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, This is typically used for preprinted or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
field.label: Vital Signs Sponsor-Defined Identifier
field.name: VSSPID
field.questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

self.title: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name

field.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
field.label: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name
field.name: VSTPT
field.questionText: What is the planned time point for this vital signs measurement?

field.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Category for Vital Signs
field.name: VSCAT
field.questionText: What was the category of the vital signs?

field.definition: A sub-division of the VSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Subcategory for Vital Signs
field.name: VSSCAT
field.questionText: What was the subcategory of the vital signs?

field.definition: The instance number of a test that is repeated within a given timeframe for the same test. The level of granularity can vary (e.g., within a time point, within a visit).
field.label: Vital Signs Repetition Number
field.name: VSREPNUM
field.questionText: What was the repetition number within the time point for this measurement?

field.definition: Descriptive name of the test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
field.label: Vital Signs Test Name
field.name: VSTEST
field.questionText: What is the vital sign test name?

field.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
field.label: Vital Signs Completion Status
field.name: VSSTAT
field.questionText: Indicate if the vital signs measurement was not done

self.title: VS Result or Finding in Original Units

field.definition: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
field.label: VS Result or Finding in Original Units
field.name: VSORRES
field.questionText: What was the result of the measurement?

field.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
field.label: VS Original Units
field.name: VSORRESU
field.questionText: What was the unit of the measurement?

field.definition: An indication whether the vital sign result was clinically significant.
field.label: Vital Signs Clinical Significance
field.name: VSCLSIG
field.questionText: Was the result clinically significant?

field.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of Vital Signs measurement.
field.label: Location of Vital Signs Measurement
field.name: VSLOC
field.questionText: What was the anatomical location where the measurement was taken?

field.definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
field.label: Vital Signs Position of Subject
field.name: VSPOS
field.questionText: What was the position of the subject during the measurement?

field.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
field.label: Vital Signs Directionality
field.name: VSDIR
field.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the measurement?

field.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.
field.label: Vital Signs Laterality
field.name: VSLAT
field.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the vital signs measurement?

class.label: Findings
class.name: Findings

field.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field.label: Study Identifier
field.name: STUDYID
field.questionText: What is the study identifier?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field.label: Study Site Identifier
field.name: SITEID
field.questionText: What is the site identifier?

field.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
field.name: SUBJID
field.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

field.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
field.label: Visit Name
field.name: VISIT
field.questionText: What is the visit name?

field.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
field.label: Visit Date
field.name: VISDAT
field.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

field.definition: An indication of whether or not a planned lab measurement, series of lab measurements, tests, observations or was performed or specimens collected.
field.label: Lab Performed
field.name: LBPERF
field.questionText: Was the sample collected?; Was the lab performed?

field.definition: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Specimen Collection Date
field.name: LBDAT
field.questionText: What was the date of the lab specimen collection?

field.definition: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field.label: Specimen Collection Time
field.name: LBTIM
field.questionText: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?

field.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Category for Lab Test
field.name: LBCAT
field.questionText: What was the name of the lab panel?

field.definition: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Subcategory for Lab Test
field.name: LBSCAT
field.questionText: What was the name of the lab sub-panel?

field.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
field.label: Lab Planned Time Point Name
field.name: LBTPT
field.questionText: What was the planned time point of the lab?

field.definition: Indication whether the testing condition defined in the protocol were met (e.g., Low fat diet).
field.label: Lab Test Condition Met
field.name: LBCOND
field.questionText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

field.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
field.label: Lab Fasting Status
field.name: LBFAST
field.questionText: Was the subject fasting?

field.definition: An internal or external identifier such as specimen identifier.
field.label: Lab Specimen ID
field.name: LBREFID
field.questionText: What was the (laboratory test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field.label: Study Identifier
field.name: STUDYID
field.questionText: What is the study identifier?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field.label: Study Site Identifier
field.name: SITEID
field.questionText: What is the site identifier?

field.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
field.name: SUBJID
field.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

field.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
field.label: Visit Name
field.name: VISIT
field.questionText: What is the visit name?

field.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
field.label: Visit Date
field.name: VISDAT
field.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

field.definition: An indication of whether or not a planned lab measurement, series of lab measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.
field.label: Lab Performed
field.name: LBPERF
field.questionText: Was the sample collected?; Was the lab performed?

field.definition: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Specimen Collection Date
field.name: LBDAT
field.questionText: What was the date of the lab specimen collection

field.definition: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field.label: Specimen Collection Time
field.name: LBTIM
field.questionText: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?

field.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Category for Lab Test
field.name: LBCAT
field.questionText: What was the name of the lab panel?

field.definition: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Subcategory for Lab Test
field.name: LBSCAT
field.questionText: What was the name of the lab sub-panel?

field.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
field.label: Lab Planned Time Point Name
field.name: LBTPT
field.questionText: What was the planned time point of the lab?

field.definition: Indication whether the testing condition defined in the protocol were met (e.g., Low fat diet).
field.label: Lab Test Condition Met
field.name: LBCOND
field.questionText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

field.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
field.label: Lab Fasting Status
field.name: LBFAST
field.questionText: Was the subject fasting?

field.definition: Descriptive name of the lab test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test.
field.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
field.name: LBTEST
field.questionText: What was the lab test name?

self.title: Lab Result or Finding in Original Units

field.definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
field.label: Lab Result or Finding in Original Units
field.name: LBORRES
field.questionText: What was the result of the lab test?

field.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
field.label: Lab Original Units
field.name: LBORRESU
field.questionText: What was the unit of the lab result?

field.definition: An indication whether lab test results were clinically significant.
field.label: Lab Clinical Significance
field.name: LBCLSIG
field.questionText: Was this result clinically significant?

field.definition: An internal or external identifier (e.g., specimen identifier).
field.label: Lab Specimen ID
field.name: LBREFID
field.questionText: What was the (laboratory test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

self.title: Lab Method of Test or Examination

field.definition: Method of the test or examination.
field.label: Lab Method of Test or Examination
field.name: LBMETHOD
field.questionText: What was the method used for the lab test or examination?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field.label: Study Identifier
field.name: STUDYID
field.questionText: What is the study identifier?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field.label: Study Site Identifier
field.name: SITEID
field.questionText: What is the site identifier?

field.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
field.name: SUBJID
field.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

field.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
field.label: Visit Name
field.name: VISIT
field.questionText: What is the visit name?

field.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
field.label: Visit Date
field.name: VISDAT
field.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

field.definition: An indication of whether or not a planned lab measurement, series of lab measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.
field.label: Lab Performed
field.name: LBPERF
field.questionText: Was the sample collected?; Was the lab performed?

field.definition: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Specimen Collection Date
field.name: LBDAT
field.questionText: What was the date of the lab specimen collection?

field.definition: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field.label: Specimen Collection Time
field.name: LBTIM
field.questionText: What was the (start) time of the lab specimen collection?

field.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Category for Lab Test
field.name: LBCAT
field.questionText: What was the name of the lab panel?

field.definition: A sub-division of the LBCAT values based on user defined characteristics.
field.label: Subcategory for Lab Test
field.name: LBSCAT
field.questionText: What was the name of the lab sub-panel?

field.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
field.label: Lab Planned Time Point Name
field.name: LBTPT
field.questionText: What was the planned time point of the lab?

field.definition: An indication that the subject has abstained from food/water for the specified amount of time.
field.label: Lab Fasting Status
field.name: LBFAST
field.questionText: Was the subject fasting?

field.definition: Indication whether the testing condition defined in the protocol were met (e.g., Low fat diet).
field.label: Lab Test Condition Met
field.name: LBCOND
field.questionText: Were the protocol-defined testing conditions met?

field.definition: Description of the condition of the specimen.
field.label: Lab Specimen Condition
field.name: LBSPCCND
field.questionText: What was the condition of the specimen?

field.definition: Descriptive name of the lab test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding. Any test normally performed by a clinical laboratory is considered a lab test.
field.label: Lab Test or Examination Name
field.name: LBTEST
field.questionText: What was the lab test name?

self.title: Lab Result or Finding in Original Units

field.definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
field.label: Lab Result or Finding in Original Units
field.name: LBORRES
field.questionText: What was the result of the lab test?

self.title: Lab Method of Test or Examination

field.definition: Method of the test or examination.
field.label: Lab Method of Test or Examination
field.name: LBMETHOD
field.questionText: What was the method used for the lab test or examination?

field.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
field.label: Lab Original Units
field.name: LBORRESU
field.questionText: What was the unit of the lab result?

field.definition: The unit of the result as originally received if it were collected as a non-standard unit.
field.label: Lab Collected Non-Standard Unit
field.name: LBCRESU
field.questionText: What was the unit of the lab result?

field.definition: The toxicity grade using a standard toxicity scale (e.g., NCI CTCAE).
field.label: Lab Standard Toxicity Grade
field.name: LBTOXGR
field.questionText: What is the Toxicity Grade?

field.definition: A description of toxicity quantified by LBTOXGR (e.g., NCI CTCAE Short Name).
field.label: Lab Toxicity
field.name: LBTOX
field.questionText: What is the description of the toxicity?

self.title: Lab Ref Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit

field.definition: The lower end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in LBORRES.
field.label: Lab Ref Range Lower Limit in Orig Unit
field.name: LBORNRLO
field.questionText: What was the lower limit of the reference range for this lab test?

self.title: Lab Ref Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit

field.definition: The upper end of normal range or reference range for continuous results stored in LBORRES.
field.label: Lab Ref Range Upper Limit in Orig Unit
field.name: LBORNRHI
field.questionText: What was the high limit of the reference range for this lab test?

field.definition: An indication or description about how the value compares to the normal range or reference range.
field.label: Lab Reference Range Indicator
field.name: LBNRIND
field.questionText: How [did/do] the reported values compare within the [reference/normal/expected] range?

field.definition: An indication whether lab test results were clinically significant.
field.label: Lab Clinical Significance
field.name: LBCLSIG
field.questionText: Was this result clinically significant?

field.definition: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
field.label: Vendor Name
field.name: LBNAM
field.questionText: What was the name of the laboratory used?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
field.label: Study Identifier
field.name: STUDYID
field.questionText: What is the study identifier?

field.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
field.label: Study Site Identifier
field.name: SITEID
field.questionText: What is the site identifier?

field.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
field.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
field.name: SUBJID
field.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

field.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
field.label: Visit Name
field.name: VISIT
field.questionText: What is the visit name?

field.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
field.label: Visit Date
field.name: VISDAT
field.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

field.definition: An indication whether or not a planned vital signs measurement, series of vital signs measurements, tests, or observations was performed.
field.label: Vital Signs Performed
field.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSPERF
field.questionText: Were [vital signs/[VSTEST] performed?

field.definition: The date of the vital signs measurement, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
field.label: Vital Signs Date
field.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSDAT
field.questionText: What was the date of the measurement(s)?

field.definition: The time of measurement, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
field.label: Vital Signs Time
field.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSTIM
field.questionText: What was the time of the measurement(s)?

field.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Category for Vital Signs
field.name: VSCAT
field.questionText: What was the category of the vital signs?

field.definition: A sub-division of the VSCAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
field.label: Subcategory for Vital Signs
field.name: VSSCAT
field.questionText: What was the subcategory of the vital signs?

field.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier used to tie a block of related records in a single domain.
field.label: Vital Signs Group ID
field.name: VSGRPID
field.questionText: What is the vital signs group identifier?

self.title: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name

field.definition: A text description of planned time point when measurements should be taken as defined in the protocol.
field.label: Vital Signs Planned Time Point Name
field.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSTPT
field.questionText: What is the planned time point for this vital signs measurement?

field.definition: The variable used to indicate that data are not available by having the site recording the value as "Not Done".
field.label: Vital Signs Completion Status
field.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSSTAT
field.questionText: Indicate if the [VSTEST] measurement was not done

self.title: VS Result or Finding in Original Units

field.definition: Result of the vital signs measurement as originally received or collected.
field.label: VS Result or Finding in Original Units
field.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSORRES
field.questionText: What was the result of the [VSTEST] measurement?

field.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
field.label: VS Original Units
field.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSORRESU
field.questionText: What was the unit of the [VSTEST] measurement?

field.definition: An indication whether the vital signs results were clinically significant.
field.label: Vital Signs Clinical Significance
field.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSCLSIG
field.questionText: Was the [VSTEST] result clinically significant?

field.definition: The position of the subject during a measurement or examination.
field.label: Vital Signs Position of Subject
field.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSPOS
field.questionText: What was the position of the subject during the [VSTEST] measurement?

field.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject relevant to the collection of Vital Signs measurement.
field.label: Location of Vital Signs Measurement
field.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSLOC
field.questionText: What was the anatomical location where the [VSTEST] measurement was taken?

field.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location further detailing the side of the body.
field.label: Vital Signs Laterality
field.name: [VSTESTCD]_VSLAT
field.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the [VSTEST] measurement?

product.description: The Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization (CDASH) Model, the CDASH Implementation Guide (CDASHIG), and the CDASHIG Metadata Table define basic standards for the collection of clinical trial data and how to implement the standard for specific case report forms (CRFs). CDASH establishes a standard way to collect data in a similar way across studies and sponsors, so that data collection formats and structures provide clear traceability of submission data into the Study Data Tabulation Model (SDTM), delivering more transparency to regulators and others who conduct data review. The CDASH standard directly supports the production of clinical data collection instruments. Through this support, the standard also contributes to: Consistency and detail in representations of research protocol concepts Streamlined processes within medical research Development of a corporate library of standardized CRFs Use of metadata repositories Reporting and regulatory submission Data warehouse population Data archiving Post-marketing studies/safety surveillance There is growing recognition around the globe that industry standards promote data interchange, which is essential to effective partnering and information exchange between and among clinicians and researchers. Clinical care can more easily reap benefits through medical research findings, and more clinicians will be interested in conducting research if the research process can be integrated into their clinical care workflow. CDISC encourages the adoption of its global standards for clinical research, which should continue to be harmonized with healthcare standards, to provide a means for interoperability among healthcare and research systems such that medical research can support informed healthcare decisions and improve patient safety. This document is intended to be used by persons involved in the planning, collection, management, and analysis of clinical trials and clinical data, including clinical investigators, medical monitors, clinical research associates (monitors), clinical research study coordinators, clinical data standards subject matter experts (SMEs), clinical data managers, clinical data and statistical programmers, biostatisticians, drug safety monitors, CRF designers, and others tasked with the responsibility to collect, clean, and ensure the integrity of clinical trial data. Although much of the language in this standard addresses development of (e)CRFs, the CDASH standard can also be leveraged for other data sources. The principles and the metadata presented here can be applied to eSource (also known as non-CRF) data such as vendors' electronic data transfer standards, ePRO data structures, and direct data acquisition from electronic healthcare record (EHR) systems.
product.label: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.1
product.name: CDASHIG v2.1
product.source: Prepared by the CDISC CDASH Team
